fixes.name: Median Sales Price National
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau MEDIAN([Price]) to DAX MEDIAN over the Price column and created it as a measure because it is an aggregate.

fixes.name: Median Sales Price % Increase
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR medPrice = MEDIAN('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Price])
VAR medLastSold = MEDIAN('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Last Sold For])
RETURN ((medPrice - medLastSold) / medLastSold) * 100
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated the aggregate expression using DAX MEDIAN for both columns and computed the percentage change. This is a measure due to use of aggregations.

fixes.name: County Drill Down
fixes.solution_explanation: Mapped Tableau IF [State Set] THEN [COUNTYNAME] END to DAX IF(condition, value, BLANK()). It is a row-level operation without aggregation, so it is a calculated column.
